name: signoz
description: SigNoz is an open-source observability platform for metrics, logs, and traces, built as a self-hosted alternative to Datadog and New Relic. It supports OpenTelemetry, dashboards, and alerting.
features: Distributed tracing: Visualizes request flows across microservices with trace timelines.
Metrics monitoring: Collects and displays application and infrastructure metrics in dashboards.
Log management: Aggregates logs from multiple sources with search and filtering.
OpenTelemetry native: Built on OpenTelemetry for vendor-neutral instrumentation.
Custom dashboards: Creates visualizations with charts, graphs, and tables for metrics.
Alert rules: Configures alerts based on metrics, traces, or log patterns.
Service maps: Automatically generates topology maps showing service dependencies.
Query builder: Builds complex queries with visual interface or PromQL-like syntax.
Anomaly detection: Identifies unusual patterns in metrics and traces automatically.
Data retention: Configures retention policies for traces, metrics, and logs separately.
Team collaboration: Shares dashboards and alerts across team members.
ClickHouse backend: Uses ClickHouse for fast querying of large observability datasets.
